Unmarked burial grounds are often discovered when construction inadvertently disturbs burials, creating heartache in the community. The African American Burial Grounds Network Act will help support the community efforts to address issues like this: http://www.wbtv.com/story/14299645/dozens-of-unmarked-graves-of-slaves-found-in-meck-co/ …

This bill will help communities preserve their local history & allow descendants of those interred to visit/honor their family members, while also better informing development decisions & community planning in growing areas like Mecklenburg County #BurialGroundAct #preservation

That’s why today, during #BlackHistoryMonth , I introduced the African American Burial Grounds Act with @RepMcEachin to create & maintain a national network of African American burial grounds. pic.twitter.com/AI8lJl5qIv

The graves of African Americans have too frequently been forgotten or neglected by the communities they’re located in. Even in cases where communities care deeply, they often don’t have the funds or technical assistance needed to preserve this.

Twenty-six years after the FMLA was signed, people need #paidleave, and a national plan like the #FAMILYAct would benefit them and their families, businesses and the economy. #Paidleave means everybody wins.
About 40% of the workforce isn't eligible to take unpaid leave through the FMLA. It's past time for a national #paidleave guarantee – the #FAMILYAct.
#Paidleave means the freedom to start a family if, when and how you choose. And it should be available to all women and working people, no matter where you live or work. #FAMILYAct

The theme of this speech has been, “listen to my words and pay no attention to my deeds.” #StateOfTheUnion2019

Yes, we are over-processing and over-criminalizing poor persons and marginalized communities. It’s time for step two of criminal justice reform, and that is why I invited Cedric as my guest. #StateOfTheUnion2019

Tonight I have Cedric Dean with me. He’s a testament to the need for continued reforms. The First Step Act was just that, a first step towards reforms. It’s time to move with more reforms within in all courts and at all levels. #StateOfTheUnion2019
It’s one thing to talk on a staff-prepared teleprompter, and it’s another to actually govern and lead.  Actions will always speak louder than words. #StateOfTheUnion2019

Tonight I’m joining the women of the @HouseDemocrats in wearing suffragette white for the #SOTU. We wear white to stand in solidarity with the women who came before us & to show that we are continuing to fight #ForThePeople and to advance women’s rights. pic.twitter.com/Qnf7uRI7JS
Thank you @nowthisnews for speaking with me about my #SOTU, Cedric Dean, and the work that still needs to be done to truly reform our criminal justice system. pic.twitter.com/hh4EDUuu98

We congratulate @SpelmanCollege Board Chair Roz Brewer for her election to @Amazon Board of Directors. This is another example of how HBCU alum are increasing #techdiversity. HBCUs are the key to tech diversity. #HBCUCaucus https://www.reuters.com/article/us-amazon-com-board/amazon-adds-starbucks-rosalind-brewer-to-board-idUSKCN1PT2BB …

Last year’s First STEP Act was just that – a first step.  There is still so much work to be done. Cedric and I will send a message to President Trump and Congress that we need to continue our efforts to truly reform our criminal justice system.
There are striking inequities in our criminal justice system and it is clear that we are over-criminalizing and over-processing certain communities and crimes.
For women, incarceration is up 700% with African American women six times more likely to be incarcerated than white women, and Latinas are twice as likely.

Half of African American men will be arrested at some point in their lives. Right here in NC, African Americans account for 52% of the incarcerated population and only 28% of the state’s total population

I am proud to bring Cedric Dean as my guest of honor to the #SOTU. Cedric spent over 28 years in prison on two felony charges. Thanks to vital sentencing reforms he was given an opportunity to win back his freedom. pic.twitter.com/8oRLjCDgOc
Today, I am announcing my SOTU guest. His story is one of perseverance and overcoming overwhelming obstacles. His experiences are all too common, and it’s time for us to work together to address it.

Today for #BlackHistoryMonth we honor Septima Poinsette Clark. A civil right activists who created citizenship schools that helped many African Americans vote. She was also active with NAACP in getting more black teachers hired in the south. pic.twitter.com/MR5iCEuASg
On Monday, February 4th, I will be announcing who will be my guest to the State of the Union. Tune in Monday! pic.twitter.com/Sh2uhNHCdq

Today is the start of #BlackHistoryMonth . Join me each week as I highlight & celebrate the bold Black women trailblazers who have reshaped & redefined the fabric of America.
